bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Essex County was formed from Old Rappahannock County in 1692.
Archibald McCall was a merchant of Essex County, Virginia. George McCall, his brother, was a lawyer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Court records relating to the suit between the brothers Archibald and George McCall, regarding fees charged by George McCall for defending his brother Archibald in various law suits. Documentation of various suits is included.

originalsloc.head: Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals located in Essex County Circuit Court. Tappahannock, VA 22560.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: A more legible version of these records can be found on Essex County Chancery Causes Microfilm Reel Number 434 - image 272 and Essex County Chancery Causes Microfilm Reel Number 435 - image 9.

Additional Essex County Chancery Causes can be found by searching the Chancery Records Index available electronically at the website of the Library of Virginia at http://www.lva.lib.va.us/whatwehave/local/chancery/index.htm
